history.text: What are your thoughts on Catch Me If You Can?
although this is not a major Spielberg film, I believe Leonardo Dicaprio does a great job portraying Frank Abagnale.
Do you think Catch Me If you Can received a fair score?
It was genuinely funny though, Martin Scorsese really outdid himself. It shouldve scored lowered it was rather boring to me.
However you cannot deny the brilliance this con man performed, played by Leonardo DiCaprio. Unbelievable how he outsmarted the fbi for so long.
It seemed to drag along, It was also lame to me that he helped the FBI, even after they captured him and used him as a pawn. Did you enjoy Tom Hanks character?
you mentioned the film was genuinely funny, do you think that added to the biographical crime drama or added to it
I think it took away from the seriousness of the film
Im surprised he did all those crimes at such a young age though

You commented that it was lame that the FBI used him after his capture. However, as mentioned above it is biographical this is what he did in real life and totally agree about how young he was. Just before his 19th birthday
Do you think Franks circumstances justified his actions?
Do you feel for him?
Yes I do, stealing from the rich is the best to do in aiding to equality, the federal government used him like a slave id never have helped them
what is your opinion on it?
Well he posed as a Pan American World Airways Pilot, I think that posed a huge threat. Imagine the passengers finding out he is not a real pilot.
This story takes place in 1963 and beyond. Do you think it was easier to commit a crime such as what Frank did portrayed in this movie?
Do you like Steven Spielberg, No I believe with the internet nowadays , anything you seek is one screen away.
I enjoy Steven Spielberg films. He often times works on big budget commercial films. Even though this is not considered as of the bigs. This was an interesting story to tell.

Did you enjoy the scenes in this film showing
 the hardships he faced while in jail?

Carl visits Frank on multiple occasions. Eventually convincing the fbi that his skill set is necessary for the fbi department. However, once out he attempts to fly once again. Do you think he learned his lesson? I think not
I do not think so, do you think what he did was wrong? The thrill of the chase is something we all seek
Apparently his misbehavior was not enough for the fbi to not want him.
He meets up with Carl and they discuss their next case
Did you like the scenes him as a teenager in New York?
It was sad when his father died
I think he lived a crazy life, and his fathers death is what finally broke him down enough to stop what he was doing and report himself to the fbi
Do you think it is weird how America celebrates people such as Frank as a hero? From criminal to now hero

It isnt weird, he is a beacon of freedom, showing that you can judge on superficial statuses or moral berameters, but on the skills and values they have that have the potential to change society as a whole.
what is your stance on the matter?
He lived a criminal life and was able to gain valuable skills and experiences other hard working citizens will never get the opportunity to experience. He now makes millions
That is there choice, he showed them that anything is possible if you put your mind to it.
did you like franks sisters role in the movie?
anything is possible even if it means breaking the law and causing countless people pain and taking away their hard earned money
I do not think what I mentioned above is fair in any way.

uid2response.feedback: This was nostalgic I have not watched this movie in a while. It was interesting to see how someone else felt about the film.
